name: dominantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is more important, strong, or noticeable than anything else of the same type: She uses dominantly blue and grey tones in her paintings. The storytelling is accompanied by sound effects created by flutes, a guitar and, most dominantly, drums. Synonym
predominantly
biology
  specialized (of a gene) in a way that always produces a particular characteristic in a person, plant, or animal: The condition is passed on to children dominantly. It is a dominantly inherited form of diabetes, that mostly affects young people.
anatomy
  specialized A part of the body that is used dominantly is used more, or has more effect than a body part of the same type on the other side of the body: Handedness is defined as the hand that carries out most tasks dominantly. The people in the study seemed to be more dominantly right-brained or left-brained. Related word
dominant
More examplesFewer examplesThe clergy was a dominantly male sphere.His guitar is heard dominantly in the mix.The state had always been dominantly Democratic.Often female singers were used in background vocals or a chorus, rather than singing solo or dominantly enough for their voices to be distinguished.In the dominantly inherited form of this disorder, the iron deficiency is mild.
